newsitem.title: QATAR: Qatar says Bahrain military pilot seeking asylum.
newsitem.headline: Qatar says Bahrain military pilot seeking asylum.

text.p: A Bahraini military pilot sought political asylum in neighbouring Qatar on Monday after landing his helicopter in the capital Doha, the official Qatar News Agency (QNA) said.

It quoted a Qatar foreign ministry source as saying First Lieutenant Nasser Majed Nasser al-Khalifa arrived at Doha International Airport at 4 p.m. (1300 GMT). It added officials were considering his appeal.
It was not immediately clear if the pilot belonged to Bahrain's al-Khalifa ruling family.

Bahrain's official Gulf News Agency said military authorities were searching for a Bahraini royal air force helicopter, which had departed from Manama at 2.50 p.m. (1150 GMT). It said the chopper was on a training flight, but gave no further details.

Qatar and Bahrain, two tiny Gulf Arab states, are locked in a dispute over a number of islands and reefs in the strategic waterway. Manama has controlled the potentially oil and gas-rich territories since the 1930s, but they are also claimed by Qatar.

Ties were further strained this month after Bahrain sentenced two alleged Qatari spies to three years in jail. Bahrain's Emir Sheikh Isa bin Sulman al-Khalifa pardoned the two on Saturday. Doha, which had denied the two were spies, welcomed the move.
